chapter.title: The Groovy Plugin
chapter.para:
The Groovy plugin extends the Java plugin to add support for Groovy projects. It can deal with Groovy-only projects and with mixed Java/Groovy projects. It can even deal with Java-only projects.
We don't recommend this, as the Groovy plugin uses the Groovyc Ant task to compile the sources. For pure Java projects you might rather stick with javac. In particular as you would have to supply a groovy jar for doing this.
The Groovy plugin supports joint compilation of Java and Groovy. This means that your project can contain Groovy classes which use Java classes, and vice versa.

section.title: Project layout
section.para:
The Groovy plugin assumes the project layout shown in . All the Groovy source directories can contain Groovy and Java code. The Java source directories may only contain Java source code.
We are using the same conventions as introduced by Russel Winders Gant tool ().
None of these directories need exist or have anything in them. The Groovy plugin will compile whatever it finds, and handles anything which is missing.

section.title: Dependency management
section.para: The Groovy plugin adds a dependency configuration called groovy.

Gradle is written in Groovy and allows you to write your build scripts in Groovy. But this is an internal aspect of Gradle which is strictly separated from building Groovy projects. You are free to choose the Groovy version your project should be build with. This Groovy version is not just used for compiling your code and running your tests. The groovyc compiler and the the groovydoc tool are also taken from the Groovy version you provide. As usual, with freedom comes responsibility ;). You are not just free to choose a Groovy version, you have to provide one. Gradle expects that the groovy libraries are assigned to the groovy dependency configuration. section.title: CompileGroovy
section.para: The Groovy plugin adds a instance for each source set in the project. The task type extends the Compile task (see ). The compile task delegates to the Ant Groovyc task to do the compile. Via the compile task you can set most of the properties of Ants Groovyc task.
